title.label: i‚Äôm terrible at this but great game!

content.label:
pretty much just been trying to go for fewest moves on single suit and my record is still 86. 

very well designed however and incredibly good twist on regular old solitaire. would highly recommend!
Latest version moves is not lined up after a game in my 11pm.
Pretty straightforward and fun, whether you‚Äôve got a few minutes to kill or you‚Äôre taking a dump, this is a great way to spend that time with a deal or two

With the clipboard issue resolved, Flipflop is back to a 5-star game. So happy‚ÄîI have spent an embarrassing number of hours entertained by this game! I like fun, but not not mindless, pass times and this hits the mark.

title.label: One of the better solitaire apps BUT

content.label:
Really love this app but some of the challenges/achievements don‚Äôt really seem possible. 

There appears to be some kind of bug saying I‚Äôve quit games when I never have (I‚Äôm stubborn). Not sure what that‚Äôs about. 

The game appears to be abandoned so I wager these issues will persist. A shame because it‚Äôs
an otherwise excellent game though!
I would say this was a 5/5 if the cards I paid for were available to me, but I end up having to keep paying for them over and over again to no avail.

title.label: Will buy anything from Zack Gage but...

content.label:
Every game needs a menu button to access to a tutorial.  Whether it‚Äôs been a minute since I played (and I can‚Äôt remember the rules - which honestly happens more often than not since Zack‚Äôs games bend the rules) or I want to show them to someone else - 

Everyone of Zack‚Äôs awesome games should let you run through the tutorial at any time.  Maybe that‚Äôs already the case but I missed it - but I‚Äôm trying to play right now and it‚Äôs been a couple of weeks and I don‚Äôt remember the rules and cannot find a way to replay the tutorial.  

So that is literally my only complaint - you want people to play in a new way? Create and amazing tutorial?  Let people access the tutorial when they come back to the game.
Whole thing died after I paid for many sessions and now put me bAck to 1 with no clear way to restore my puchase!

title.label: app phones home / User hostile developer inserted ads into paid version

content.label:
He‚Äôs done it yet again. New ad in an app I paid to be add less. How did it get that add? By phoning home. 

Developer inserted ads into paid version and app phones home. The developer updates this app specifically to insert an ad into the paid version. They now run a chiron atop the top of the ad for his own products when I paid to remove this kind of visual assault. Apparently it phones home as well because today it started calling for me to tap on the add. 

This developer acts like he‚Äôs playing a game against his customers to see how he can get over on them. I will never give this developer another dime and I urge you to avoid paying to be lied to. 

(Oh, and I can‚Äôt share my purchase with my wife even though she is listed under my account despite the fact the app claims otherwise.)

App crashes on launch, once you get it to start and want to play a game it shows you ads that you can‚Äôt exit out of when all you want to do is play.

I get that ad supported play is a business model, but there is a better way to do that.
Bought it on another device and when I hit the ‚ÄúRestore purchase‚Äù button it says it‚Äôs loading then does nothing and doesn‚Äôt restore the purchase.
I can‚Äôt handle them anymore! üò§üò≠ü§Æüí©üí©üí©

title.label: Great but way too many ads

content.label:
Great game! Really fun and lots of replayability. But the ads are too much and too long. I get you gotta make money, but having an add before every game? And there‚Äôs no timer of how long I have to wait. 

I never download any of the ads anyways.

I respect that someone has taken somewhat traditional games and made them unique. I‚Äôve only played a few of these solitaire games but now want to investigate more Gage games. 

I‚Äôve played tons of card solitaire in my life and this ranks high on my list. I haven‚Äôt had a problem with ads yet but I‚Äôm a believer in supporting people like this creator so I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll pay for no ads.

When you exit out of the game it defaults to a loss of the hand, so for those that complete every game, your percentage goes down. It lessens the challenge lowering the games fun. I hope the creators see this and fix that little bug.

This little game is incredibly addictive. One deck had stymied me for months until the most recent update that fixed a bug letting you put a king on an ace. I never knew you could do that. Boom! #236 bites the dust! :-)

I love this game, but I really wish it was possible to come back to game you ‚Äúskipped‚Äù previously. Because of the button placement I keep hitting New Game instead of Restart and it‚Äôs driving me crazy that I keep racking up these unfinished games and lowering my stats. Please add a feature to let me replay those games!

title.label: a clever game-frustrating and more of a puzzle and less of a game

content.label:
i get that solitaire can be difficult.  you want me to buy 200 more games but this has turned into a more of a puzzle and less of a game.  it looks like there is one and only one way to win some games and that means it is not fun.  if you are going to do this, give hints.

additionally make a toggle to turn off sound.    i do not like the fact that i have to flip the sound switch on my phone to play this in a public place
Used to be a great game before all the ads. I can no longer play on long flights because it ‚Äúfailed to load the ad‚Äù.  Won‚Äôt let me play.  What a waste.
Apparently a bug was fixed that allowed stats to be reset on delete and reinstall. Thanks

This game is horrible. You can win every time in single suit but as soon as you try to move up to additional suits you may as well deal the cards, select menu and choose quit game. Then go outside, or talk to a real person, maybe even enroll in that community college course you‚Äôve been thinking about doing. Anything you do will be a better use of your time rather than trying to play this game on the additional suits levels. And use your money to buy an actual deck of playing cards and play the game with your hands...like our grandparents did.

title.label: Great Game - I think I found a bug üòÑ

content.label: Hey Zach, love your game!!! I sadly play this thing everyday. I did just finish a game the DID NOT have the Ace of Spades. I even took a screen shot. Super crazy!!! I wanted to send you the pick just for fun. Thanks again for this game.

It‚Äôs a fun game. I mostly keep it to one suit but when there are ads, there are several that you can‚Äôt exit out of. No x to tap, no ‚Äúdone‚Äù to tap, nothing. So I have to exit the app and hope that the next ad has an x so I can play the game. I just now tried and had to exit out 3 times. The fourth time I just gave up because I can‚Äôt play. Please ensure the ads can be exited out of. It‚Äôs a frozen screen otherwise and becomes a useless app.

title.label: Constant ads that give no option to close so you can‚Äôt play

content.label:
Yep. I constantly get ads that will not let me close them no matter how long I wait. Absolutely infuriating. I can quit the app and start it back up to only run into the same issue before I can even start a game. 

The game itself is really fun but the ad glitch just seems like a ploy to get me to buy the ad free version. Not gonna do it. I‚Äôll just play a different game.
Give yourself time to adjust to Zach‚Äôs fun spin on classic solitaire. This game is a BLAST. The learning curve (especially for multiple suits) is challenging but WORTH it.

Love this app, especially since you can personally tweet Zach Gage and he will tweet you back (or at least for me) I had a question about the game, it was a glitch bc it said the ad removal was $00.2 cents or something like that and I was confused but he said it was a glitch and it was going to be resolved soon! Anyways other than that I love the standard version and the one suit! Very nice set up and I like the removal of the clock option! The only bad thing is the ads, but just put your phone on airplane mode and your good! I have had this app for a while and am looking forward to more of Zach Gage‚Äôs apps!! üíóüíóüíó
Love the game... but can‚Äôt purchase because it‚Äôs stuck in a connecting to server mode anytime I try.
I‚Äôve really enjoyed this game. The different suit variations keep things interesting.
Really like the game but lately it‚Äôs been crashing within 30 seconds of opening app. Seems like a bug fix is needed
Fun game but after the app was accidentally deleted I am unable to get it restored. Don‚Äôt want to pay for it twice.

I like this game but I do have a few complaints. I do realize how great it is to get this game for free but the fact that if I‚Äôm not connected to WiFi I can‚Äôt play because ads can‚Äôt play is pretty annoying. I like to ply this game on the bus and sometimes I can‚Äôt play for days because I forget to connect to internet and watch the ad.
Also sometimes there‚Äôs random bugs and you can‚Äôt move cards that should be movable and you end up using more turns or not being able to play right. 
I also don‚Äôt think you should get deducted for using the undo button but that‚Äôs just a minor thing. 
Overall it‚Äôs an enjoyable game and I love the way it plays. That‚Äôs why these small things are so disappointing.

Aesthetically this game is gorgeous, but quite frequently now (like one out of every three games) there‚Äôs some game-ending bug that forces a quit (like the Ace card getting stuck in the pile and can‚Äôt be dragged to a new column). Apart from the bugs it‚Äôs okay.
Zero challenge.

On one hand the gameplay is novel and fresh and well made and I like it. On the other hand you have to fork over a payment or watch mandatory ads to get gameplays.

So thanks, I hate it

title.label: Love the game. Disappointed with the update

content.label: I used to play this game all of the time when I would travel. It was my go-to on long flights or train rides. I updated the app this week and was very disappointed to find out that now you can‚Äôt play it offline anymore unless you pay extra. I guess I will be finding a new game.

I really enjoy playing this game, BUT for a game that does not require internet connection during gameplay, the developers have rendered the game unplayable without an internet connection. Why is that? It requires you to play an internet ad before you can continue, or offers you the option to buy the game to play offline. Every other card game that I have played (that uses ads) does not lock the game when you are offline. Pretty shady way to make a few bucks by rendering an internet-free game only usable with a connection.

And excessive. I‚Äôll try playing again in a few months or something and see if they‚Äôve decided to change ad timing and frequency. They‚Äôre not bad on any other apps by Zach that I have...not sure why this one is different

I have completely stopped playing regular solitaire, because this game has completely taken over my life. I'll go literal HOURS promising myself "Oh, just one more," or "I'll just play until I get to a nice round number of games."

That said, it's a little annoying that if you restart a deal but don't play immediately, the game disappears and turns into a loss. Also, sometimes the deal freezes, and if you try to play through, sometimes it'll think you're pressing undo. But that resolves more or less if you quit and come back. It's mainly the first thing that bothers me, and that's just because I'm super-competitivewith myself üòÇ It certainly hasn't stopped me playing!

title.label: Fun but uses ton of battery

content.label: It‚Äôs a fun game but it drains my battery really fast

The ads are bad enough, but the fact that this app eats through my battery power is unacceptable. I‚Äôve had complex, full graphic games do better than this, and have my iPad becomes less warm.

Not very good programming.

title.label: I paid for the game and I can‚Äôt play it without an internet connection.

content.label:
Bought levels for the game and played one when boarding my plane. Once we took off the app said I needed to connect to the internet to play an ad before I could continue. I think it‚Äôs ridiculous that levels I paid for are behind an ad barrier. 

I would get a refund if I could.
I paid $2.99 for ‚Äúfull game unlock‚Äù and it now says I need to pay $1.99 more to unlock the decks. Pretty fun game, but feel mislead by IAPs.

title.label: Not sure why I‚Äôm still seeing ads after paying

content.label: There appears to no way to disable the ads which are really annoying

It‚Äôs a nice twist to regular solitaire, but the ‚Äú100% of deals are solvable‚Äù tag is a blatant lie; there would be no need for a ‚Äòdeck solve percentage‚Äô if it was true, and it would be near impossible to make all deals solvable, considering the game‚Äôs nature.
Great take on solitaire with a few different play options. Fast paced, fun, and simple.

I love the game; it‚Äôs a great idea. I love solitaire and I think that the app has an appealing look. The ads make it almost unplayable now. After very other game, I will get a 30-second unskippable ad. If turn off my WiFi/data, the app whines about needing to pad an ad. I understand that it needs to generate revenue, but this is ridiculous. I wouldn‚Äôt mind banner ads, but the constant video ads make me want to delete the app altogether.
Random games keep having cards glitch out (can‚Äôt be tapped/moved, get frozen partially off screen or jump to wrong pile)
I had the game in airplane mode and when the game wanted to run an ad it locked up and was unplayable while offline. Made the flight extremely boring after that. üò¢üëé
The game is fun. I got to play maybe ten matches and then it hung on a waiting to load ad screen. It won‚Äôt go away. Deleting.

I was happy to pay the 2.99 IAP to unlock the full game and support a developer like this who monetizes fairly and gives you a lot of bang for your buck. 

This is a great twist on solitaire with tons of replayability with all the different modes. And I really like the art design. 

Thank you!
